intro: Canthium andamanicum, commonly known as the Andaman hogweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
